conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine if the particle returns to its starting point at 3 seconds.
Graph shows velocity on y-axis and time on x-axis.
From t=0 to t=1 second, velocity is constant at +2 m/s.
From t=1 to t=2 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from +2 m/s to 0 m/s.
From t=2 to t=3 seconds, velocity decreases linearly from 0 m/s to -2 m/s.
Displacement is the integral of velocity over time.
Displacement can be found by calculating the area under the velocity-time graph.
Area from t=0 to t=1 s is a rectangle with area 2 m.
Area from t=1 to t=2 s is a triangle with area 1 m.
Area from t=2 to t=3 s is a triangle with area -1 m.
Total displacement is 2 m + 1 m - 1 m = 1 m.
Particle has not returned to its starting point; it is 1 meter away.
No, the particle has not returned to its starting point at the 3-second mark.
